main event: A round, white object was observed on radar, resembling Venus, 6 miles southeast of Lompoc, California in October 1957.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar for approximately 30 minutes,The sighting occurred at 1745 during clear weather with visibility of 30 miles,The round object emitted intermittent white light when the weather was clear at dusk,The sighting involved a USAF radar crew as witnesses,The object was described as similar to a star or planet.
